snippet: A shooting near Times Square raised questions about the police’s use of deadly force, especially in a crowded area.
abstract: Accidental shooting of two pedestrians by New York City police in Times Square has once again raised questions about the use of deadly force, especially in crowded areas; shots were fired in attempt to subdue Glenn Broadnax, who was resisting arrest and making threatening gestures, though he did not have weapon; number of bystanders were deeply critical of police, saying incident was handled in sloppy fashion.

byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and J. DAVID GOODMAN

lead_paragraph: A shooting near Times Square raised questions about the police’s use of deadly force, especially in a crowded area.

headline.main: Police Bullets Hit Bystanders, and Questions Rise Yet Again
headline.print_headline: Police Bullets Hit Bystanders, And Questions Rise Yet Again
